member.name: M:VectSharp.FormattedText.Format(System.String,VectSharp.Font,VectSharp.Font,VectSharp.Font,VectSharp.Font,VectSharp.Brush)
member.summary: Parse the formatting information contained in a text string into a collection of objects.
member.param: The font that will be used for text that is neither bold nor italic.
The font that will be used for text that is bold. Note that this does not necessarily have to be a bold font; this is just the font that is applied to text contained within tags.
The font that will be used for text that is in italics. Note that this does not necessarily have to be an italic font; this is just the font that is applied to text contained within tags.
The font that will be used for text that is both in bold and in italics.
The default that will be used for text runs that do not specify a colour. If this is , the default will be the one specified in the painting call.
member.returns: A lazy collection of objects. Note that every enumeration of this collection causes the text to be parsed again; if you need to enumerate this collection more than once, you should probably convert it e.g. to a .

member.name: M:VectSharp.FormattedText.Format(System.String,VectSharp.FontFamily.StandardFontFamilies,System.Double,System.Boolean,VectSharp.Brush)
member.summary: Parse the formatting information contained in a text string into a collection of objects, using fonts from a standard font family.
member.param: The font family from which the fonts will be created. If this is a regular font family, the bold, italic and bold-italic versions of the font will be used for the formatted text. Otherwise, the relevant font styles will be toggled (e.g. if the supplied font family is bold, then regular text in the formatted string will be displayed as bold, while bold text in the formatted string will be displayed as regular text).
The size of the fonts to use.
Determines whether text should be underlined by default. This is toggled by <u></u> tags.
The default that will be used for text runs that do not specify a colour. If this is , the default will be the one specified in the painting call.
member.returns: A lazy collection of objects. Note that every enumeration of this collection causes the text to be parsed again; if you need to enumerate this collection more than once, you should probably convert it e.g. to a .

member.summary: A method that is used to rasterise a region of a object. Set this to if you wish to use the default rasterisation methods (implemented by either VectSharp.Raster, or VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp). You will have to provide your own implementation of this method if neither VectSharp.Raster nor VectSharp.Raster.ImageSharp are referenced by your project. The first argument of this method is the to be rasterised, the second is a representing the region to rasterise, the third is a representing the scale, and the third is a boolean value indicating whether the resulting should be interpolated.

member.name: T:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG
member.summary: Contains methods to create animated PNG image files.

member.name: T:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression
member.summary: Types of inter-frame compression.

member.name: F:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression.None
member.summary: No inter-frame compression is performed (fastest, but produces the largest files).

member.name: F:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression.First
member.summary: Inter-frame compression is performed by encoding the difference between each frame and the first frame in the animation.

member.name: F:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.InterframeCompression.Previous
member.summary: Inter-frame compression is performed by encoding the difference between each frame and the previous frame (produces the smallest files, but it is the slowest and requires large amounts of memory).

member.name: T:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.CompressedFrame
member.summary: Represents an individual frame of a PNG animation.

member.name: P:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.CompressedFrame.Duration
member.summary: The duration of the frame in milliseconds.

member.name: M:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.CompressedFrame.#ctor(VectSharp.DisposableIntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new from raw pixel data in RGB or RGBA format.
member.param: A pointer to the raw pixel data for the frame.
The width of the image in pixels.
The height of the image in pixels.
If the image data is in RGBA format, set this to ; if it is in RGB format, set it to .
The duration of the frame in milliseconds.

member.name: M:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.CompressedFrame.#ctor(VectSharp.DisposableIntPtr,VectSharp.DisposableIntPtr,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new from raw pixel data in RGB or RGBA format, applying inter-frame compression based on another frame.
member.param: A pointer to the raw pixel data for the new frame.
A pointer to the raw pixel data for the frame to use as a reference. This can either be the first frame in the animation, or the frame immediately preceeding the current frame.
If is the raw pixel data for the first frame in the animation, set this to ; if it is the immediately preceeding frame, set this to .
The width of the image in pixels.
The height of the image in pixels.
If the image data is in RGBA format, set this to ; if it is in RGB format, set it to .
The duration of the frame in milliseconds.

member.name: M:VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.Create(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{VectSharp.AnimatedPNG.CompressedFrame},System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new animated PNG image, outputting it to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream to which the animated PNG image will be written.
The width of the image in pixels.
The height of the image in pixels.
If the frames of the image have an alpha channel, set this to ; otherwise, set it to .
The frames that will be used to create the animated PNG image.
The number of times that the animation should loop. Set this to 0 for an infinitely repeating animation.

member.name: T:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile
member.summary: Represents a font file in TrueType format. Reference: http://stevehanov.ca/blog/?id=143, https://developer.apple.com/fonts/TrueType-Reference-Manual/, https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/

member.name: P:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.FontStream
member.summary: A stream pointing to the TrueType file source (either on disk or in memory). Never dispose this stream directly; if you really need to, call instead.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Destroy
member.summary: Remove this TrueType file from the cache, clear the tables and release the . Only call this when the actual file that was used to create this object needs to be changed!

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.SubsetFont(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Char,System.Char})
member.summary: Create a subset of the TrueType file, containing only the glyphs for the specified characters.
member.param: A string containing the characters for which the glyphs should be included.
If true, the character map is rearranged so that the included glyphs start at the unicode U+0032 control point.
If is true, entries will be added to this dictionary mapping the original characters to the new map (that starts at U+0033).

member.name: T:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.TrueTypePoint
member.summary: Represents a point in a TrueType path description.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.TrueTypePoint.X
member.summary: The horizontal coordinate of the point.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.TrueTypePoint.Y
member.summary: The vertical coordinate of the point.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.TrueTypePoint.IsOnCurve
member.summary: Whether the point is a point on the curve, or a control point of a quadratic Bezier curve.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetFontFamilyName
member.summary: Obtains the font family name from the TrueType file.
member.returns: The font family name, if available; otherwise.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetFullFontFamilyName
member.summary: Obtains the full font family name from the TrueType file.
member.returns: The full font family name, if available; otherwise.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetFontName
member.summary: Obtains the PostScript font name from the TrueType file.
member.returns: The PostScript font name, if available; otherwise.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetFirstCharIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the first character glyph represented by the font.
member.returns: The index of the first character glyph represented by the font.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetLastCharIndex
member.summary: Returns the index of the last character glyph represented by the font.
member.returns: The index of the last character glyph represented by the font.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsItalic
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is Italic or Oblique or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is Italic or Oblique or not.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsOblique
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is Oblique or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is Oblique or not.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsBold
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is Bold or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is Bold or not

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsFixedPitch
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is fixed-pitch (aka monospaces) or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is fixed-pitch (aka monospaces) or not.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsSerif
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is serifed or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is serifed or not.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.IsScript
member.summary: Determines whether the typeface is a script typeface or not.
member.returns: A indicating whether the typeface is a script typeface or not.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetGlyphIndex(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines the index of the glyph corresponding to a certain character.
member.param: The character whose glyph is sought.
member.returns: The index of the glyph in the TrueType file.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetGlyphPath(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Get the path that describes the shape of a glyph.
member.param: The index of the glyph whose path is sought.
The font size to be used for the font coordinates.
member.returns: An array of contours, each of which is itself an array of TrueType points.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetGlyphPath(System.Char,System.Double)
member.summary: Get the path that describes the shape of a glyph.
member.param: The glyph whose path is sought.
The font size to be used for the font coordinates.
member.returns: An array of contours, each of which is itself an array of TrueType points.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmGlyphWidth(System.Char)
member.summary: Computes the advance width of a glyph, in thousandths of em unit.
member.param: The glyph whose advance width is to be computed.
member.returns: The advance width of the glyph in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmGlyphWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the advance width of a glyph, in thousandths of em unit.
member.param: The index of the glyph whose advance width is to be computed.
member.returns: The advance width of the glyph in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmWinAscent
member.summary: Computes the font's Win ascent, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The font's Win ascent in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmAscent
member.summary: Computes the font ascent, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The font ascent in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmDescent
member.summary: Computes the font descent, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The font descent in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmYMax
member.summary: Computes the maximum height over the baseline of the font, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The maximum height over the baseline of the font in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmYMin
member.summary: Computes the maximum depth below the baseline of the font, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The maximum depth below the baseline of the font in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmXMax
member.summary: Computes the maximum distance to the right of the glyph origin of the font, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The maximum distance to the right of the glyph origin of the font in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmXMin
member.summary: Computes the maximum distance to the left of the glyph origin of the font, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The maximum distance to the left of the glyph origin of the font in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: T:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Bearings
member.summary: Represents the left- and right-side bearings of a glyph.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Bearings.LeftSideBearing
member.summary: The left-side bearing of the glyph.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Bearings.RightSideBearing
member.summary: The right-side bearing of the glyph.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmGlyphBearings(System.Char)
member.summary: Computes the left- and right- side bearings of a glyph, in thousandths of em unit.
member.param: The glyph whose bearings are to be computed.
member.returns: The left- and right- side bearings of the glyph in thousandths of em unit

member.name: T:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.VerticalMetrics
member.summary: Represents the maximum heigth above and depth below the baseline of a glyph.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.VerticalMetrics.YMin
member.summary: The maximum depth below the baseline of the glyph.

member.name: F:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.VerticalMetrics.YMax
member.summary: The maximum height above the baseline of the glyph.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmGlyphVerticalMetrics(System.Char)
member.summary: Computes the vertical metrics of a glyph, in thousandths of em unit.
member.param: The glyph whose vertical metrics are to be computed.
member.returns: The vertical metrics of a glyph, in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmUnderlinePosition
member.summary: Computes the distance of the top of the underline from the baseline, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The distance of the top of the underline from the baseline, in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmUnderlineThickness
member.summary: Computes the thickness of the underline, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: The thickness of the underline, in thousandths of em unit.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetUnitsPerEm
member.summary: Returns the number of units for each em in the font file. Multiplying any glyph measurement by this size should generally lead to an integer value.
member.returns: The number of units for each em in the font file.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.GetItalicAngle
member.summary: Computes the italic angle for the current font, in thousandths of em unit. This is computed from the vertical and is negative for text that leans forwards.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmUnderlineIntersections(System.Char,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the intersections between an underline at the specified position and thickness and a glyph, in thousandths of em units.
member.param: The glyph whose intersections with the underline will be computed.
The distance of the top of the underline from the baseline, in thousandths of em unit.
The thickness of the underline, in thousandths of em unit.
member.returns: If the underline does not intersect the glyph, this method returns . Otherwise, it returns an array containing two elements, representing the horizontal coordinates of the leftmost and rightmost intersection points.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmKerning(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Gets the kerning between two glyphs.
member.param: The first glyph of the kerning pair.
The second glyph of the kerning pair.
member.returns: A object containing information about how the position of each glyphs should be altered.

member.name: M:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.Get1000EmKerning(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the kerning between two glyphs.
member.param: The index of the first glyph of the kerning pair.
The index of the second glyph of the kerning pair.
member.returns: A object containing information about how the position of each glyphs should be altered.

member.name: T:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.PairKerning
member.summary: Contains information describing how the position of two glyphs in a kerning pair should be altered.

member.name: P:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.PairKerning.Glyph1Placement
member.summary: This vector contains the displacement that should be applied to the first glyph of the pair.

member.name: P:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.PairKerning.Glyph1Advance
member.summary: This vector describes how the advance width of the first glyph should be altered.

member.name: P:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.PairKerning.Glyph2Placement
member.summary: This vector contains the displacement that should be applied to the second glyph of the pair.

member.name: P:VectSharp.TrueTypeFile.PairKerning.Glyph2Advance
member.summary: This vector describes how the advance width of the second glyph should be altered.
